intro: Timonius benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet timonius, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are erect and sturdy. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Timonius benguetensis is considered a vulnerable species.
